intro: Ptilotus roei, commonly known as the sandhill star, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually small and fleshy, adapted to conserve water. Ptilotus roei is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
